subject: Fashion
title: When Pink Was for Boys
description: A 60-second lesson on When Pink Was for Boys.

hook.text: In 1918, a leading trade magazine declared pink the ideal color for boys. Blue was for girls.

buildup.text: Pink was considered a strong, decisive colorâ€”close to red. Blue was delicate and dainty.

discovery.text: The swap happened gradually in the 1940s. Retailers, not science, drove the change.

twist.text: Nazi camps marked gay men with pink triangles, which may have pushed boys away from the color.

climax.text: By the 1980s, pink-for-girls was so entrenched that people forgot it was ever different.

punchline.text: The 'natural' color rule? A marketing accident.

quiz.question: Before the 1940s, which color was commonly associated with boys?
